songs.full_title: Before You Go by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Before You Go

description.plain:
“Before You Go” is about the aftermath of someone close committing suicide, including feeling like you are responsible for their death. Throughout the track, Lewis repeatedly questions whether he could have done something to prevent it.

Lewis teased the track by posting a snippet on his social media accounts one day before its release.

songs.full_title: Bruises by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Bruises

description.plain:
“Bruises” is the second track and first single from Lewis Capaldi’s first album, Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent (Expanded Edition). The lyrics deftly deal with heartache and end of a long-term relationship.

He explains: “At times your memory of an old relationship will be clouded and you’ll only seem to remember the best parts of being with someone. Completely ignoring the reasons why things came to an end makes the idea of holding on to it or wanting to go back to it seem more enticing than it actually is.”

body.plain: This was Lewis Capaldi’s first ever song uploaded which he did on SoundCloud at 18. This is the song that got him discovered by his manager, Ryan Walter.

songs.lyrics:
Burning in the Back of Your Mind Lyrics
Well am I burning in the back of your mind
'Cause girl I can't get you out of mine
And I heard you say that you'd come of age
But girl you don't look any older to me

And what becomes of you
When the fat lady sings her last tune?
And what becomes of you?
Can you say it's true that the life you lived
Was a a life meant to be lived by you?
When you're holding on by a pin or a thread
Will you think of me when you take your last breath?
When you're crying out for a little more time
Will I still be burning there
In the back of your mind?

And well I know that with time there comes change
But I think I more or less did the same
Wonder if the same can be said for you
Girl have you stayed the same too?

And what becomes of you
When the fat lady sings her last tune?
And what becomes of you?
Can you say it's true that the life you lived
Was a life meant to be lived by you?

When you're holding on by a pin or a thread
Will you think of me when you take your last breath?
When you're crying out for a little more time
Will I still be burning there
In the back of your mind?
You might also like
Well how was life living out on your own?
How was life out of house and of home?
Did you do the things that you said you would?
Or right the wrongs that you said you should?

And what became of you

songs.title: Cockapoo / Maldives (Bleak Mornings on BBC Radio 1)
songs.title_with_featured: Cockapoo / Maldives (Bleak Mornings on BBC Radio 1)

description.plain:
This song was performed based on a story) told by BBC Radio 1 listener Lauren. The morning after Lauren had returned from her holiday in the Maldives, she was cleaning up her cockapoo Rory’s vomit.



A cockapoo

Lewis Capaldi, accompanied by pianist Aiden Halliday, performed this song on the radio show hosted by Greg James called Bleak Mornings, which is a show in which listeners/callers’ sad morning stories are improvised into songs by the guest performer.

songs.full_title: Don't Get Me Wrong by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Don’t Get Me Wrong

description.plain:
“Don’t Get Me Wrong” is the eighth track on Lewis Capaldi’s number one album, Divinely Uninspired To A Hellish Extent.

The song is about him wanting to be with someone he knows he can’t be with. Every time he reluctantly steps away this person always comes back and it pains him to reject this special person over and over again.

songs.full_title: Fade by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Fade

description.plain:
“Fade” is Lewis Capaldi’s third single of 2017, and his opening track of his debut EP, Bloom.

Lewis Capaldi explained the song’s content to Huffington Post:

“Fade” was just me wanting to write about the moment in a relationship you realize that you’re so enamoured with someone, so much so that you couldn’t imagine yourself living without even all the bad traits they have.

songs.full_title: Forever by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Forever

description.plain:
“Forever” comprises the sixth track on Lewis Capaldi’s album, Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent. As another love song on this album, this slow, sentimental ballad was synthesised mainly with piano and combined with a mellow bass.

Here, Capaldi expresses that everything is temporary, like relationships or life itself. No matter how hard someone tries to achieve a potential goal of a lifetime with a person you commit to, the term forever is such an abstract term which people cannot comprehend fully. Even though forever was not an initial intention of both partners in this song, a meaningful and mutual connection is always hoped and searched for.

songs.full_title: Grace by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Grace

description.plain:
“Grace” is a single released by Scottish singer-songwriter Lewis Capaldi, which peaked at #21 in the UK Singles Chart in March 2019 – despite being released several months earlier. It is the first track and fourth single on Divinely Uninspired to a Hellish Extent (Expanded Edition).

The track appears to detail Capaldi’s struggles in regards to getting over a past relationship, despite it’s uplifting and humorous music video, in which he dances on a pole in a local Gentlemen’s club.

songs.full_title: Hold Me While You Wait by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Hold Me While You Wait

description.plain:
“Hold Me While You Wait” is a piano ballad about a breakup. It is the second single from the album, following “Someone You Loved.” As Lewis puts it in his well-renowned Instagram stories, this song is about him wanting a cuddle with his girlfriend of six months after she unexpectedly tells him that she hates him. Lewis says,

Nothing a couple of hugs can’t fix.

In another statement, Lewis said,

“Hold Me While You Wait” is a song I wrote about the uncertainty of being in a relationship when your partner isn’t sure what they want. There’s an impending hopelessness to the whole thing, on both sides, when they’re not sure whether they want to be in that relationship or not. For me it’s one of the most desperate places you can find yourself in.

“Hold Me While You Wait” debuted at #4 in the UK singles chart while “Someone You Loved” was still at #1. He became the second artist to have two singles in the Top 5, the first artist to accomplish this being Ed Sheeran. The song debuted at #1 in the Irish and the Scottish singles charts.

songs.full_title: Let It Roll by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Let It Roll

description.plain:
“Let It Roll” expresses themes of a futile relationship and one’s obsessive love becoming their own detriment, as expressed through the repeated line, “Weigh down heavy like you did before/ Let me hold your rolling heart of stone”.

Moreover, In an interview, Capaldi briefly explained the melody behind “Let it Roll”, as well as other songs of a similar style. As a result of attempting to liven up his workspace at home, his songs have resulted in what he describes as,

[Something] like, still really sad, but fast, like you’re crying, but you’re running while you do it.

Furthermore, this song, like many others he has composed, was inspired by “girls he’s met”, as can be read in this interview https://www.rollingstone.com/music/music-features/lewis-capaldi-interview-1001491/.
As a result, “Let it Roll” was born, accumulating praise for its beautiful, intense melodies and orchestral tones.

songs.full_title: Mercy by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Mercy

description.plain:
Lewis Capaldi’s Mercy primarily emphasizes themes regarding the painful fallout of a one-sided relationship. This point is notably highlighted in the repeated phrase, “It hurts to see you’re all right when I’m not alright”.

More specifically, Capaldi expressed some of his lyrical inspiration to Genius regarding this prominent line, as well as the general thesis of the song:

This song for me, is about the moment someone is being told by their boyfriend or girlfriend that they don’t want to be with them anymore.
[…]
[Moreover] I think the worst way a relationship can end is when one person just one day realizes they don’t feel like they want to be with the other anymore…to be the person who’s still in love is a horrible position to be in. There’s nothing worse than seeing the other person not be as torn up about things coming to and end as you are.

body.plain:
Lewis Capaldi’s Mercy primarily emphasizes themes regarding the painful fallout of a one-sided relationship. This point is notably highlighted in the repeated phrase, “It hurts to see you’re all right when I’m not alright”.

More specifically, Capaldi expressed some of his lyrical inspiration to Genius regarding this prominent line, as well as the general thesis of the song:

This song for me, is about the moment someone is being told by their boyfriend or girlfriend that they don’t want to be with them anymore.
[…]
[Moreover] I think the worst way a relationship can end is when one person just one day realizes they don’t feel like they want to be with the other anymore…to be the person who’s still in love is a horrible position to be in. There’s nothing worse than seeing the other person not be as torn up about things coming to and end as you are.

songs.full_title: One by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: One

description.plain: In the song “One,“ Lewis explores the difficulties of a relationship and the idea that you can give your all, but receive nothing in return. However, it is also emphasised within this song that the heartbreak that is experienced as a result of unconditional love can also be mended by another who has experienced the same.

songs.full_title: Rush by Lewis Capaldi (Ft. Jessie Reyez)
songs.title: Rush

description.plain: Rush’ is all about heartbreak and the weird headspace you occupy after the end of a relationship where you feel like absolute shit and, if you’re being honest with yourself, you hope the other person feels just as bad. Of course, the flip side of that is you obviously still care about this person, so really you hope they’re not experiencing the shit because you know how bad it feels and wouldn’t want that for them. So the whole tune is this internal conflict you’re having as you think about the situation,“ says Lewis

songs.full_title: Someone You Loved by Lewis Capaldi
songs.title: Someone You Loved

description.plain:
During his speech at The BRIT Awards 2020, Lewis confirmed that contrary to popular belief, this song is about his grandmother (as opposed to an ex-lover).

The music video, starring the former Doctor Who star  Peter Capaldi, depicts him as a widower. He is content, but when he meets a young mother and her family, who his wife had donated a heart to, and he gets to listen to her heartbeat again.

“Someone You Loved” was Lewis' first UK number 1 single and spent seven consecutive weeks at the top. It also hit #1 on Scotland and Ireland’s charts.

TranslationsSvenskaEspañolPortuguêsDeutschNederlandsSomeone You Loved Lyrics
I'm going under, and this time, I fear there's no one to save me
This all or nothing really got a way of driving me crazy
I need somebody to hear,  somebody to know
Somebody to have, somebody to hold
It's easy to say, but it's never the same
I guess I kinda liked the way you numbed all the pain

Now, the day bleeds into nightfall
And you're not here to get me through it all
I let my guard down and then you pulled the rug
I was getting kinda used to being someone you loved

This all or nothing way of loving got me sleeping without you

I was getting kinda used to being someone you loved
